title: Bold swashy serif
content:
Nasjonalbaletten by Halvor Bodin.

What font(s) are used?

[http://img218.imageshack.us/img218/2868/picture1fb7.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/img218.imageshack.us/img218/2868/picture1fb7.png "http://img218.imageshack.us/img218/2868/picture1fb7.png")  
 [http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/2518/picture3rc5.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/img136.imageshack.us/img136/2518/picture3rc5.png "http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/2518/picture3rc5.png")

 [‹ Tate Modern "Rings of Saturn" chunky rounded font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/typophile.com/node/32009 "Go to previous forum topic") [Strategies of learning font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/typophile.com/node/32025 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cuidado

comments.content:
[Cabernet/Cabernet Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/www.jawarts.com/Fonts.htm)? And [Optima](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/www.identifont.com/show?T9).

EDIT: Check all the cabernet-characters (Regular + Swash) at [veer.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044934/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000060#characters).
Cabernet Swash seems to be it! Thanks.
